column9: There is increase in IEBR for MNRE to Rs. 9193 crore  in 2016-17 (RE) in comparision to Rs.5431crore in 2015-16 (RE). Major allocation from IEBR is made to Indian Renewable Energy Development Authority (IREDA) of Rs. 9119 crore.
There is 20 times increase in Gross Budgetray Support for MNRE in 2016-17 (BE) of Rs. 5000 crore in comparision to 2015-16 (RE) of Rs. 247 crore. However
column10: this allocation may not be matching with finance requirement arised after the last year revision in target of Renewable Energy to 175 GW.

column8: Above figures includes funds made available from National Clean Energy Funds
column9: There is slight decrease in allocation for the scheme of Grid Interactive Renewable Power. The restructured scheme have considered capacity addition for transmission and distribution of renewable energy which is a welcome step.

column1: Off Grid / Distributed and Decentralised Renewable Power
column8: Above figures includes funds made available from National Clean Energy Funds
column9: There is a visible increase in allocation for the Scheme of Off Grid / Distributed and Decentralised Renewable Power with allocation of Rs. 983 crore in 2016-17 (BE) in comparison to Rs. 97 crore in 2015-16 (RE).

column8: Above figures includes funds made available from National Clean Energy Funds
column9: There is quantum increaseof 5 folds in budget allocation for Research,Design and Development in Renewable Energy in Budget 2016-17 in comprision to previous year.
